title: Metaplanet Increases Bitcoin Holdings With $13.5M Purchase and Bond Issuance
author: James Van Straten
summary: The Japanese hotel company has acquired more bitcoin and issues zero-interest bonds.
content:
Japanese hotel company Metaplanet (3350) has acquired 162 bitcoin
BTC
$104,523.82
for $13.5 million at an average price of $83,123 per bitcoin, achieving a year-to-date bitcoin yield of 53.2%.

The BTC yield represents the percentage change in the ratio of bitcoin holdings to fully diluted shares outstanding over a given period. As of March 12, Metaplanet holds 3,050 BTC valued at $253.7 million, with an average acquisition price of $83,180 per bitcoin.

Additionally, the company has issued 2 billion JPY ($13.5 million) in zero interest ordinary bonds to fund further bitcoin acquisitions. At the time of writing, Metaplanet shares were trading at 3,630 yen, down almost 50% from it's all-time high in February.

llm_analysis.reasoning: The news describes a company increasing its Bitcoin holdings through significant purchases and bond issuance, indicating institutional buying and market confidence.
